com.google.wave.api
Class Gadget

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.Element
      com.google.wave.api.Gadget

public class Gadget
extends Element

Gadgets are external code that can be executed within a protected environment within a Wave. Gadgets are indentified by the url that points to their gadget specification. Gadgets can also maintain state that both they and Robots can modify.

Author:
scovitz@google.com (Seth Covitz), mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya)

          Constructs an empty gadget.

          Constructs a gadget for the specified url.

getUrl

Returns:
the URL for the gadget.

setUrl

public void setUrl(java.lang.String url)
Changes the URL for the gadget to the given url. This will cause the new gadget to be initialized and loaded.

Parameters:
url - the new gadget url.

deleteField

public void deleteField(java.lang.String key)
Deletes the field represented by the given key from the gadget's state.

Parameters:
key - The key that identifies the field.

getField

public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String key)
Returns the value of the field with the given key.

Parameters:
key - The key that identifies the field.
Returns:
The value of the field.

setField

public void setField(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String value)
Creates or replaces a field matching the key with the given value. Only a single field with a given key is allowed.
